posts.author: Valerionx
posts.content: I'm looking for help in a halfling rogue for arelith, lv 30 cap. Although, If viable (meaning it would work overall with some benefit) I was wondering if Shadowdancer could also be in the mix with it. Although, I'm not terribly good with builds so you might guys might think it's not worth it, so let me hear your thoughts ^^.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hail, Valerionx!

Welcome to the ECB, mate!

You need to provide more information about not only your kind of toon, but any specific changes that Arelith has made to the class / classes that you want to use. Any typical Rogue / Shadowdancer will be good. I would suggest something like Rogue 19 Fighter 6 Shadowdancer 5 with Rogue 12 Fighter 4 pre-epic Shadowdancer 4. I know you need to take at least 3 levels of a class consecutively in Arelith, but I know that there's been a change to Hide in Plain Sight (the main reason to take Shadowdancer). Just make sure you know the changes and let us know them as well so we can help you. Imagine if we make you a great build, then you find out it's illegal in Arelith, or doesn't work as you intended? It won't be fun, for you cuz you won't be able to play it, and for the builder who just spent his time making something that won't be used.

Take it EZ!

Cool, thanks! That makes our job a lot easier.

Now thinking about Shadow Evade, you are a flanker. With 19 Rogue levels (10 d6 Sneak damage), you shouldn't fight head-on unless really unavoidable. So that bears the question, even though it has been beefed up, what will you use it for? I can only think of Archers and other Flankers such as yourself. You're a halfling, so small size will make KDing harder, which means you should be the one attacking from the side or the back most of the time, not taking the hits.

As for Hide and Move Silently, it's a good bonus, and definitely worth 5 levels, but no more IMO. I think these changes only make the spread above more appealing. 19 Rogue, 6 Fighter 5 Shadowdancer seems the best way to go. I'll try to build you something, although I don't know what skills are useful in Arelith. You can figure out the skills on your own, right? I'll do the basic stuff, but feel free to adjust it to your perception of Arelith useful skills.

I'll post it when I'm done.

Take it EZ!

Just to help you a bit more, this is a small alteration to Max's build with the skills you want and somewhat better saves. You can set all (save gas) deadly traps with a modified 15 ranks in set traps.
Similarly you can open all locks/gates up to a required score of 40 (50 with +10 tools) and disable all traps up to a required score of 50, that should be more than enough.
